alert.note: Alert for Chesapeake; Hampton, Poquoson; Isle of Wight; Newport News; Norfolk, Portsmouth; Suffolk; Virginia Beach; York (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 22 at 5:58PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Isle of Wight, and southeastern York Counties, the City of Poquoson, the City of Norfolk, the northwestern City of Chesapeake, the City of Portsmouth, the northeastern City of Suffolk, the northwestern City of Virginia Beach, the City of Hampton and the central City of Newport News through 645 PM EDT... At 558 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Grand View, or over Langley AFB, moving south at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Virginia Beach, Newport News, Hampton, Smithfield, Langley AFB, Ocean View, Kempsville, Virginia Wesleyan University, Hampton University, Old Dominion University, Christopher Newport University, Downtown Norfolk, Regent University, Patrick Henry Field, Downtown Portsmouth, Churchland, Norfolk State University, Norfolk, Chesapeake and Portsmouth. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for southeastern Virginia.

area.areaDesc: Chesapeake; Hampton, Poquoson; Isle of Wight; Newport News; Norfolk, Portsmouth; Suffolk; Virginia Beach; York
